In addition to the Basic [Protocol], the nav6 firmware implements several messages which may be useful to more advanced users. 

= Advanced Messages =

== Raw Sensor Data Update Message ==

The Raw Sensor Data update message communications notifications of raw sensors readings; this update message may be useful when the Yaw/Pitch/Roll/Compass Heading provides insufficient information.

||
||Byte Offset||Element||Data Type||
||0||Quaternion W (14 bits)||16-bit Integer||
||4||Quaternion X (14 bits)||16-bit Integer||
||8||Quaternion Y (14 bits)||16-bit Integer||
||12||Quaternion Z (14 bits)||16-bit Integer||
||16||Acceleration X||16-bit Integer||
||20||Acceleration Y||16-bit Integer||
||24||Acceleration Z||16-bit Integer||
||28||Magnetometer X (12 bits)||16-bit Integer||
||32||Magnetometer X (12 bits)||16-bit Integer||
||36||Magnetometer X (12 bits)||16-bit Integer||
||40||Temperature (Centigrade degrees)||Float||
||

== Stream Configuration Command ==

The Stream Configuration Command is sent to the nav6 in order to change the type of Streaming Update message the nav6 will transmit to the client.

||
||Byte Offset||Element||Data Type||
||0||Stream Type (YPR or Raw)||8-bit ASCII Character||
||

||
||Stream Type||Description||
||'y'||Yaw, Pitch, Roll & Compass Heading Update||
||'r'||Raw Sensor Data Update||
||

== Stream Configuration Response ==

Whenever a Stream Configuration Command is received by the nav6, the nav6 responds by sending a Stream Configuration Response message, which is formatted as follows:

||
||Byte Offset||Element||Data Type||
||0||Stream Type (YPR or Raw)||8-bit ASCII Character||
||1||Gyroscope Full Scale Range (Degrees/sec)||16-bit Integer||
||5||Accelerometer Full Scale Range (G)||16-bit Integer||
||9||Update Rate (Hz)||16-bit Integer||
||13||Calibrated Yaw Offset||Float||
||17||Flags||16-bit Integer||
||
